subject: Off to Spokane
event:
Bigfoot beware.  We're off to see him.

Heading for the airport, and for our family reunion -- worldcon.

Win, lose, or no award, we intend to have a great time.

We'll howl down the moon, and party like it's 1976!

comments.article: Have fun.
comments.subject: Lol

comments.article: ahhh it's like your book, Yet to be seen! but we will have the last laugh when we prove it's real!
My hometown, and I was there just a month ago.  Go to the gardens at Manito Park on the South Hill.  You'll thank me.

Unfortunately this side of the state is under an air quality advisory and everyone's being advised to stay indoors (except for needed activities obvs) because of all the fires in BC and WA! Sad day, but have a great time George and anyone else going!
Enjoy!
Won't partying like it's 1976 be next year, in Kansas City? :)

Wow. I didn't realize that next year was Kansas City's turn. That means I have zero excuse not to attend, or even volunteer to help.

August 2016, baby. Looking forward to it if there are any survivors from the Puppy wars.
Happy Bicentennial.

Safe travels!



I'm curious what you will be bringing along on the plane to read?


Enjoy the family! Good times ahead!
comments.subject: Airplane Reading?

comments.article: Safe travels Mr Martin.
I live in Spokane, as well. There is much to see and do here. Riverfront Park is great, Manito, Duncan Gardens, Japanese Gardens, many, many lakes and rivers. Good luck to you!
Surely it's next year we "party like it's 1976"?
I'm pretty sure partying like it's 1976 is how I was born the next year.
Have fun and hopefully you will bring home some hardware. As King it is your right to have the whole lot of em killed if you aren't satisfied Joffery style!!! Lol
comments.subject: Hope you have a great time and bring home some awards

comments.article:
When asked about it at the Sanquan science-fiction convention in Washington recently, Martin replied, “Don’t ask me when the book is going to be done — I’ll ask my minions to lop your head off.”

Australian Network News

Yes! Deafly done your grace! I truly hope that you took heed of my counsel above and that's why you said this! Couldn't believe it when I read that I laughed so hard after posting this above. I'm almost 100% sure you didn't say that because of my comment above but I thought it was funny that I left this comment and then you made that statement! Feel free to seek my wise counsel anytime your Grace. I will give it to you straight as Ser Davos would.
comments.subject: RE: Hope you have a great time and bring home some awards

comments.article:
Have been looking forward to this since the announcement in 2013. a week before the event I find out I have to go to Chicago for work.

Sort of like running a marathon only to be tripped in sight of the finish line.
:(

With the many conventions and meetings that you've attended over the years, are there any that stand out as the best and worst?  If you fear offending any person or group, I'd be happy to just hear about your favorite.
comments.subject: Favorite convention?

comments.article: alright mr Martin, lets cut the crap, is Stannis alive or dead
In my books?  Alive, beyond a doubt.

comments.subject: Re: With all due respect, sir...
RE: With all due respect, sir...

comments.article: we`re going to party like it`s 1976..if I did that the powers that be would lock me up till 1999..have fun
Hopefully Worldcon can keep your mind off the Jets QB woes!!
Safe travels to you Ser

*Have...a good time....All...the time*

See through the Sad Puppy darkness and enjoy the light of it all.

And on a totally random note: I'm reading some classic Mr. Natural comics right now. I've decided I would hire YOU to play the part of Mr. Natural if I ever made a live action movie version of Mr. Crumb's legendary guru. So hurry up and make some books, and I'll score a Red Camera.
comments.subject: In the words of the mighty Viv Savage of Spinal Tap

comments.article:
Dear mister Martin,
I'm a fan of yours and of your series! I've recently drawn a fanart that I really wanted to show you too so, if you don't mind, I'll leave you the link here:
http://robictheescapist.deviantart.com/art/AllMenMustDie-555001781
I'm really sorry I had to comment here but, as I say in the title, I had no better ideas! I hope you like it!
Thank you for everything, your Italian fans wish you the best!
comments.subject: I don't know where else to send you things!

comments.article: Azor Ahai and the last hero were the same person ?
comments.subject: Last Heroe

comments.article:
Have a blast!!!
www.opustjkwrites.com
comments.subject: enjoy

comments.article:
Hey George, my family is having an open party tonight at their house in Lamy if you are around. They all love your work. Two large dogs, a bunch of carpenters, and free booze!

PS no one will bother you about any future books, prophecy fulfillment, plot holes, or weird fan obsessions :)
comments.subject: A Party Where No One is Going to Die

comments.article: I hope you leave early!! It's ridiculous here I can barely see my neighbor's house with all the smoke. I was planning on going to meet you but I am going to Yakima with my parents and taking my infant & toddler sons. Please be so careful and limit your time outside or travel home because I would feel so awful if my state did you any harm. Safe travels and thank you for such a life changing series. I appreciate you.
comments.subject: Be careful!!

comments.article: The smoke was epic.  Spokane had its charms, but I must admit, I am glad to be back to the crisp clean air of Santa Fe.
comments.subject: Re: Be careful!!

comments.article: Carefull of the smoke.
